revised_title: Optical Spectra of the Lowest Triplet State in 2-Benzoylpyridine Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the optical spectra of the lowest triplet state in 2-benzoylpyridine crystals and found unique features, such as a crystal blue shift and broad, structureless phosphorescence. They explained these properties in terms of strong electron-phonon coupling and the crystal structure, which affects the behavior of the molecules in the crystal.
